answers.answer: Hello,For such sensations, parasthesia should be ruled out. Parasthesias are common in alcoholics and metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidismThey can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, nerve irritation, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms are gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then get it evaluated from a doctor. Nerve compression needs to be ruled out for which a nerve conduction velocity test can be done.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Experiencing vibration/buzzing sensation in pelvic area more to left suprapubic and have read several forums of other females also experiencing with no real answers, I am 54 y/o white female, hystrectomy at age 46, DJD, stenosis of the c-spine, and have recently had a flare with my back last week, kept going and didn't miss any work, applied ice packs and took asprin. I have only experienced this sensation once before about half year ago lasted about 5 days went away and now is back again for past 2 days. Very annoying, not painful.
title: RN
